subject: Online form with data export to sharepoint/spreadsheet
description:
From: Kavita Kapoor <Kavita.Kapoor@london2012.com>

We have a new project request. Potentially.

At each venue LOCOG will provide Games Mobility devices, you know
scooters and golf buggies etc.

We may wish to Create an online form via KitSite from approx Nov/Dec
to Apr/May. Information in the form would include; venue (drop down);
date (corresponding to venue); booking out and in times (based on
on-hours); vehicle type (3 in total but varies per venue therefore
these need to line up); name; contact number; email address; and other
comments (an open text box for questions/queries).

Ideally these requests would go direct to a mailbox e.g.
GamesMobility@london2012.com) and LOCOG will respond with a
confirmation or decline email (copy to be signed off by Kathryn) and
fed into SharePoint. However I think we can persuade this team to pick
up a spreadsheet instead like Young Games Makers.

Could I get a price for doing this bearing in mind that we have
alternative ways to service the request.

Kavita

Discussed briefly, with costs in the Â£15-25k range.
Update : Waiting for the customer to decide if they want a front end form. Back end management will be completed in house using SharePoint.

Hi Danny

The customer has decided that she is going to use our Contact Centre to manage the requests. Do this not needed.

Sorry to get your hopes up!

Kavita
Closing.

Hi Sharique,

I can confirm that there were no changes made to the docroot for the festival site during this period. Fyi, I did this as follows:
  find /apps/apache/html/festival.london2012.com -mtime -2

Do you know the nature of the Akamai error message? Does it indicate that the origin server was unreachable? or reachable, but no http connection possible, or perhaps that the apache server was reachable, but returning an http error code?

Have you consulted the Apache logs pertaining to this period? I'm happy to do so, but don't want to duplicate what you may be doing.

Kind regards,
Kieran

Hi Kieran,
We have already raise ticket with BT and they are investigating Akamai logs, we had experience this problem previously as well and previously it was Akamai who could not get any response from source, thatâs why I thought to mail you in advance in case if there was any change made, I will let you know we need any further information from Kitsite.

Thanks for your help.

Regards
Sharique

Hi Kieran,
This is what we get from BT and it looks like some files are missing on server, can you investigate this please,

Have looked back through previous ticket for this incident INC0094108

The Akamai errors are repeatedly as follows:

19/Aug/11 08:32:52 217.156.169.206 GET /D/336/129605/000/origin-festival.london2012.com/ 0 0 5000 - - - 213.120.228.200 -

Result is a 504 back to the end-user.

During the outage IPSoft looked at their device which is hosting the website and got the following:

[Fri Aug 19 11:03:40 2011] [error] [client 80.239.228.12] File does not exist: /apps/apache/html/festival.london2012.com/images/presentation
[Fri Aug 19 11:03:40 2011] [error] [client 80.239.228.12] script '/apps/apache/html/festival.london2012.com/error-404.php' not found or unable to stat [Fri Aug 19 11:05:15 2011] [error] [client 62.41.62.62] File does not exist: /apps/apache/html/festival.london2012.com/images/presentation
[Fri Aug 19 11:05:15 2011] [error] [client 62.41.62.62] script '/apps/apache/html/festival.london2012.com/error-404.php' not found or unable to stat [Fri Aug 19 11:06:11 2011] [error] [client 80.239.228.12] File does not exist: /apps/apache/html/festival.london2012.com/images/presentation
[Fri Aug 19 11:06:11 2011] [error] [client 80.239.228.12] script '/apps/apache/html/festival.london2012.com/error-404.php' not found or unable to stat [Fri Aug 19 11:08:15 2011] [error] [client 80.239.228.12] File does not exist: /apps/apache/html/festival.london2012.com/images/presentation
[Fri Aug 19 11:08:15 2011] [error] [client 80.239.228.12] script '/apps/apache/html/festival.london2012.com/error-404.php' not found or unable to stat

It is as if the server is unable to access the required files form the aplication in the /apps/apache/html/festival.london2012.com/ directory.

As IPSoft have previously stated, if this is just one website affected then it can not be the infrastructure as this hosts multiple websites.

BAU Internet, Pelase investgiate this further with the developers.


Thanks
Sharique

Hi Sharique,
Those error messages are from 19 Aug (and I believe - altho I don't have it immediately to hand - dealt with in another ticket).
This ticket is - afaik - regarding an suspected outage on 4 Sep?
Kieran

subject: Re: Issues with the Festival.London2012.com
description:
Hi,
It appears that the design collateral we received for this was missing a few
images.
  /images/presentation/dotted-border-grey.gif
  /images/interface/footer-bg.png
   -> ./images/presentation/footer-bg.png
  /images/presentation/blue-header-submit.png
It also appears that there's a missing error doc, at /error-404.php.
However, this doesn't explain why you only started seeing this behaviour
this morning. The site is a static one and hasn't changed in the last 60
days.
It might take us some time to hunt down the missing images (we might even
have to go back to the designers). Or, alternatively, we could just remove
them from the css files. It appears that no-one has noticed their absence in
60 days so they might not be that important. However ... this isn't a call
that I can make.
Can you give me an indication of what you would like us to do please?
 1. Try to contact the design agency to track down the missing images.
 2. Amend the css files to remove all reference to the above images (as it
would appear their absence is not causing a problem).
In the meantime, I will fix the missing error-404.php.
Thanks in advance,
Kieran

Hi Indy,

Thanks for this,

I think Danny was going to try and catch up with you or Uzma today re. the form (he's at Churchill Place)

A few questions / points to clarify while I think of them :

2) In terms of the Event Zones, I assume this (Part A Q1) is a drop down, but it's not clear form the attached which field goes in the drop downs?

Are the field under the "Correct zone name" header the 5 values we should use for this drop down?
What are the values in the 'Event Zone' column used for?

3) Dates / Times

I think we probably need to discuss this further, our original understanding was this was to be nothing more than a 'free text' box.
We then had some discussion on Friday with Uzama and ION re. this being a little more constrained, although nothign was agreed.
It now seems to be suggested (not unreasonably) that the dates on this part of the form is in turn constrained by the "Event Zone" selected.

While each of these incremental addition are obviously nice and given time/budget achievable, they almost certainly will have a significant impact on the work and costs involved in constructing the form [if the form is to be both dynamic and usable without Javascript for accessibility reasons it gets even more complex) and the complexity of data model needed to store the data, at both out and and ION's end.

If it is decided we need to go down the more complex route, in terms of preselecting the dates for the user are you expecting that for a given date range the user will be presented with a list of date next to which they have to add both a start and end time? 

ie. for example for the 'Royal Artillery Barracks zone" where the dates run from the 27 July - 6 August and the 29 August - 5 Sept for Olympics and Paralympics respectively, would 

27th July : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]
28th July : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]
29th July : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]
... etc.
5th August : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]
6th August : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]
29th August : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]
30th August : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]
... etc.
5th September : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]

In effect allowing up to 20x date fields each with their own start and end times?

3) When Uzma initially discussed this work and we costed it, it was based on the assumption you would look at the data collected in our backend / export it in CSV to view in Excel etc.

We now understand that you need to export the date to the database/system ION is building (we discussed this on Friday on a conference call with Uzma and ION)

Hopefully this won't present too many issues, but two things to be aware of:

 a) We were not expecting the CSV export to be used as a feed to drive another system. While we are happy to try and confirm to / use the same fields as ION is using (if ION get us the fields they are using internally in the few days then we can use those values as a basis when creating out our internal data model / form fields), we are not expecting (at least within the given costs) to build a feed exactly to ION's requirements (for example we will be exporting dates in YYYYMMDD format and will expect the ION system to import the date fields in the format, rather than us exporting dates in a custom format).

 b) We will simply be providing a 'export CSV' option in the backend CMS, you can manually export this file and email or FTP this file to ION as often as your like, but each export will contain all previous values, this should be an issue as ION can simply ignore any records they already have entered in tier system.

We can look at constructing a more tightly coupled integration with ION, but obviously there are additional costs here.

4) Location / City / Town / Place of Birth / Organisation Status

We are assuming these are free text fields? 

5) Getting a copy of the final fields that ION will be using.

In fact given that these fields will eventually need to be imported by ION it probably makes sense for them to provide us with the database fields and allowed values they are using themselves. 

Although do be aware that:

 a) we will need these values to commence work 
 b) any changes to these fields could have significant costs, on top of any CR cost from ION, we will also need to change the form, the data model, the CSV export and (depending on how far along we are) then retest everything.

7) C.2.i "Please provide the following details of your licence: " 
Does this need to be checkboxes or can it just be a drop down (ie. can a user have more than one checked?

8) C.2.ii and B.5.i "Issuing body (local authority or The Royal Parks):
I assume the values here are taken form the C column of your spreadsheet? ie. "Local Authority" ?

* please be aware that in terms of "or other please specify....................." the other field will be a separate field in our data model and therefore our CSV export ie. we will have a field called "issuing_body" and a field named "issuing_body_other" which may not entirely match with ION's data model. Although on import it should be fairly simply form them to merge these fields if that is what they required.

9) That "PART D - DECLARATION" is not require on the electronic versions, other than a checkbox next to a block of T&C text that is editable by yourselves.

Happy to have a chat though any of this...

I think the most important things in terms of getting the ball rolling are:

i) agreeing on date/time and how that works.
ii) getting the field values that ION are expecting to use (*)

(*) as I have said above we can't guarantee (within the given budget) that our CSV export will 100% match ION's data model or ideal CSV format, but we will (if we receive them this week) use them as a basis for constructing our data model meaning that only the smallest manipulation will need to be done by IOn when importing our CSV export. 

thanks

Jamie

subject: eDialog : Preference Centre Migration on domains
description:
Planned for Monday 21st

Begin forwarded message:

> From: Jamie Unwin <jamie@kitsite.com>
> Date: 17 November 2011 16:45:29 GMT
> To: Remon Smit <rsmit@e-dialog.com>
> Cc: Marc Velez <Marc.Velez@e-dialog.com>, Andrew McIver <amciver@e-dialog.com>, James Nguyen <jnguyen@e-dialog.com>, Kevin Manfredi <kmanfredi@e-dialog.com>, "'Kirsten.Turner@london2012.com'" <Kirsten.Turner@london2012.com>, "'Morag.Reavley@london2012.com'" <Morag.Reavley@london2012.com>
> Subject: Re: Preference Centre Migration on domains
> 
> Thanks Remon for chairing the call just now,
> 
> In terms of steps and timing from our end, I have listed these below (this only include our steps or steps that directly influence us).
> 
> Kirsten do you mind following this up with someone in LOOCG editorial Tom, Andy or Wahome and getting us a single point of contact for the go ahed re. putting holding pages up and taking them down.
> 
> thanks
> 
> Jamie
> 
> In advance of switchover
> ----------------------------------
> 
> - receive holding text for main site [LOCOG editorial : Tom PS or Andy W *]
> - receive holding text for festival site [LOCOG editorial : Tom PS or Wahome M *]
> 
> - lock sync form staging to live on main site [Kitsite : 30 mins]
> - lock sync form staging to live on festival site [Kitsite : 30 mins]
> 
> - update signup template / page on main site as above and push to staging [Kitsite : 1 hr]
> - update signup template / page on festival site as above and push to staging [Kitsite : 1 hr]
> 
> - obtain sign off from LOOCG that festival holding text looks OK or amend if not [LOCOG editorial : Tom PS or Andy W *]
> - obtain sign off from LOOCG that festival holding text looks OK or amend if not [LOCOG editorial : Tom PS or Andy W *]
> 
> * At this point the signed off holding pages should be sitting on both the www and festival staging servers.
> 
> Switchover
> ----------------
> 
> - New iFrame url for main www site supplied [eDialog]
> - New iFrame url for festival www site supplied [eDialog]
> 
> - obtain go ahead to push main site holding page live [LOCOG editorial]
> - obtain go ahead to push main site holding page live [LOCOG editorial]
> 
> - push holding page live on main site [Kitsite : 20 mins]
> - push holding page live on festival site [Kitsite : 20 mins]
> 
> - amend signup page to point to new url on main form and republish to staging [Kitsite : 30 mins]
> - amend signup page to point to new url on festival form and republish to staging [Kitsite : 30 mins]
> 
> - test signup form on staging www server (we still need to test on real www site as on staging the domains will differ on staging) [LOCOG/Kitsite/eDialog : 40 mins]
> - test signup form on staging festival server  (we still need to test on real festival site as on staging the domains will differ on staging) [LOCOG/Kitsite/eDialog : 40 mins]
> https://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/settings/esignup.php
> http://staging-festival.london2012.com/settings/newsletter.php
> 
> * If everything looks OK we push both pages live overwriting the holding page [Kitsite : 40 mins]
> * If it looks like we need to rollback completely, we will revert the iframe urls on staging, test and then push live.
> 
> - test signup form on live www server [LOCOG/Kitsite/eDialog : 30 mins]
> - test signup form on live festival server  [LOCOG/Kitsite/eDialog : 30 mins]
> https://www.london2012.com/settings/esignup.php
> http://festival.london2012.com/settings/newsletter.php
> 
> * If we notice an issue at this point (which is extremely unlikely given we have already tested on staging) we will revert the iframe urls on staging, test and then push live.
> 
> Jamie

subject: Dropdowns on homepage
description:
From: Andy Watkins As part of the homepage redesign weâve added sports dropdown selectors, intended primarily to improve our search rankings. However, our SEO consultant has pointed out that these may not achieve this because they donï¿½ï¿½ï¿½t have actual html links as the value parameters. Could I ask you to take a look at updating this - it doesnât look too complex to me - but then what do I know?!**** ** ** I should point out that you guys havenât built this wrong. I did specifically ask him if there were any instructions I ought to pass on, and he advised that if humans could follow the links, so would Google. **** ** ** Iâve pasted the content of his email below for info.**** ** ** Cheers,**** Andy **** ** ** Looking at the way this has been implemented I'm not sure it meets our objective of getting a direct link from your homepage to each of the sport landing pages. I'm not sure how google will interpret how this has been implemented. If you are using a drop down to create these links ideally each option in the drop down would provide a direct link. For an example of this please take a look at the CNN homepage where they have a similar drop down for their programs. **** ** ** **** ****

Latest mock ups.

One additional change - we would like to put the amended header (with the addition of text "The official mobile site of the London 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games" ) across all pages/templates on the mobile site.

Thanks
Please take a look at: https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/mobile/games/venues/aquatics-centre.php

We are amending the original desktop templates, so that the list of sports are entered as separate items, in order to facilitate the creation of list-item layout on mobile pages. These are only minor amendments but we are assuming nobody else is making amendments to these pages.

Progress so far:
- Olympic events https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/mobile/games/olympic-sports/index.php
- Venue https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/mobile/games/venues/index.php
- Paralympic events - in progress

We have copied the content from the desktop pages, but these pages are not automatically going to be kept in sync from now on, so any future changes will need to be made to both versions of a page.

You will need to check all the mobile pages for links. You may want to amend or remove links that don't go to pages on the mobile site.

We will need mobile versions of the event graphics. See https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/mobile/games/olympic-sports/gymnastics-artistic.php.

If you have any questions, please fire away.
Paralympic added: https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/mobile/games/paralympic/index.php

Have just spotted that the new text (The Official mobile website of the London 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games) overlaps the logo on my mobile - which is a relatively standard size.

Can we address this, may need to be smaller text, or by allowing the text to wrap?

Screenshot attached,

thanks,

Tom

Tom, syncing to live now switched off. These pages are not linked from anywhere else, so there should be no need to check any "hide from navigation" checkboxes. Lars is just working on the templates again, so there may be some disruption, but you can publish the sections now as well as viewing them in preview.

Potentially the text needs to be smaller, and could we introduce wrapping so that it canât go over the logo.

This is on the live mobile website so if we could fix asap,

Thanks,

Tonm
Republishing mobile site now

Still have the text overlapping on smaller screen phones.

Could we possibly make it so that either, the text wraps (I appreciate it might not be the prettiest but its better than an overlap.
Alternatively, could we make the text drop a size if it hits the logo

Tues, 29th November - Olympic football tickets on sale, first come, first served

*         Ticketing website will go live at  11:00am
